page.title:
Radio emission mechanism
Radio emission mechanism
page.normal_text:
Cosmic rays accelerated in an CR-modified shock (Ball & Kirk 1992, Duffy et al. 1995).
Cosmic rays accelerated in an CR-modified
shock (Ball & Kirk 1992, Duffy et al. 1995).

Interaction with magnetic field produces synchrotron radiation
Interaction with magnetic field produces
synchrotron radiation

Toroidal geometry and slow expansion suggestive of production of CRs in reverse shock.
Toroidal geometry and slow expansion
suggestive of production of CRs in reverse
shock.

However B field and CR energy density probably too low in reverse shock for efficient emission (Dorfi 1991, Berezhko & Ksenofontov 2000)
However B field and CR energy density
probably too low in reverse shock for
efficient emission (Dorfi 1991, Berezhko &
Ksenofontov 2000)
